title: Why are musicals so bad? - Quora

response.answer_text: So. You don’t like musical theatre. Understandable, many people don’t, but right now you’re looking for a reason to why they’re so bad and I am here to give you those reasons. 1. They’re confusing When listening to music people often zone out and cease paying attention to the meaning behind songs, this doesn’t translate well to musical theatre because almost all important plot information is presented in the form of song. 2. They’re easy to mess up Because musicals are often preformed live, there is little room for error. If a line is forgotten there is no way to fix it, if a prop malfunctions there is no way to replace it. 3. It is, like many things, a matter of preference. I don’t like popcorn, or Stranger Things, or jazz music, and that is fine. You (according to this answer) don’t like musical theatre, which is also completely fine, some people just don’t like live plays or singing or dancing or all these combined. While all three of these points being valid and there being many more reasons why someone could dislike musicals, the last reason is usually the most widespread. Often time things are just that, things, and disliking them happens.

Well, it really depends on your taste. I don’t find musicals “bad” at all (besides Cats, but… that’s for another time). I quite enjoy theater, but I understand not everyone does. Some people may not like the music style, or even the fact that there is music- after all, that’s pretty unrealistic. People don’t burst into song spontaneously. I like the music and find that it often helps progress the story and allow the audience to understand the characters more. Even with the Broadway community, some people will consider someone else’s favorite musical “bad.” I really is just all personal taste. As you can probably infer from my previous comment, I absolutely despise the musical Cats…. but I have a friend who’s seen it four times.
